sqlitedatabases

Class ScreeningsDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • sqlitedatabases.SQLiteDatabase
      • sqlitedatabases.ScreeningsDatabase

  • public class ScreeningsDatabase
extends SQLiteDatabase
    Sets up SQLite database 'screenings' with columns: screeningID (int), filmName, time (varchar()), date (varchar()). Deals with all communications to this database
    Author:
    Ned & Sam

      java.sql.ResultSet dateAndTime(java.lang.String time, java.lang.String date)
      Returns ResultSet of 'ScreeningID', 'filmName' and 'time' corresponding to 'time' and 'date' arguments
      java.sql.ResultSet displayRow(int primaryKey)
      Returns ResultSet of row corresponding to 'primaryKey'
      java.sql.ResultSet durationAndTime(java.lang.String date)
      Query for 'screenings' table and 'films' table where filmName on one equals film name on the other and the date on the screenings table is the same as the date given as an argument.
      java.sql.ResultSet getAll()
      Returns ResultSet of whole 'ScreeningsDatabse' table

      Query for two tables where filmName on one equals film name on the other.

      Checks to see if there already exists a database table for the name we require.

        public void initialise()
                throws java.sql.SQLException

      • durationAndTime

        public java.sql.ResultSet durationAndTime(java.lang.String date)
                                   throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                          java.sql.SQLException
        Query for 'screenings' table and 'films' table where filmName on one equals film name on the other and the date on the screenings table is the same as the date given as an argument. Any rows that satisfy this condition are returned as the ResultSet
        Parameters:
        date -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.sql.SQLException
